intro: Melampyrum lineare f. brachiatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved yellow larkspur, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The leaves are linear and often arranged in a rosette at the base, giving it a distinctive appearance. This plant is typically found in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and woodland edges. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it partially relies on host plants for nutrients.
